resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: In 1845, despite being shattered by the recent death of his daughter Léopoldine, Victor Hugo envisions the writing of a grand novel addressing the current events of the nineteenth century, perhaps to compete with Balzac, who is beginning the construction of the Comédie Humaine. He may have been thinking about it for a long time, but has yet to write much. His new dignity as a Pair de France allows him to consider a promising political career. However, it is immediately compromised by the public discovery of an adultery with the young Léonie d'Aunet, wife of Biard. The affair is more or less hushed up, but Hugo is strongly advised to fade for some time, leading him to seclude himself to work.
resource.chars: In 1845, despite being shattered by the recent death of his daughter Léopoldine, Victor Hugo envisions the writing of a grand novel addressing the current events of the nineteenth century, perhaps to compete with Balzac, who is beginning the construction of the Comédie Humaine. He may have been thinking about it for a long time, but has yet to write much. His new dignity as a Pair de France allows him to consider a promising political career. However, it is immediately compromised by the public discovery of an adultery with the young Léonie d'Aunet, wife of Biard. The affair is more or less hushed up, but Hugo is strongly advised to fade for some time, leading him to seclude himself to work.
